intro: Cracca benghalensis, commonly known as the Bengal crac, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
